title: Loco Roco logo
content:
I’m looking for the font font used for this psp game - if it’s custom made, do you have any ideas on similar ones?

thank you,  
s

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/locoroco_6412.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Wicked Broadway musical (and novel) font - custom designed {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20424 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Looking for 3D font like M.C. Escher's "impossible triangle" - Toit, Dummy {Tim D} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20438 "Go to next forum topic")
author: saman

comments.content:
Funhouse and Kingpin from House Industries are similar. This looks custom because those C’s don’t match - altho the O’s do, I don’t know.

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=26](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=26 "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=26")

Easily hand made. Only 4 characters to draw and then tug a bit. [FF Klunder Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.8506.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LocoRoco&sampleSize=60) is also similar.

thanks for the reply - maybe the letter c has got alternate characters? I have browsed myfonts - and Foo is the closest I’ve got so far..

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/foo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/foo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/foo/")

anyone else any ideas?

[http://www.dafont.com/baby-kruffy.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=Loco+Ro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.dafont.com/baby-kruffy.font?nb_ppp=50&text=Loco+Ro "http://www.dafont.com/baby-kruffy.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=Loco+Ro")

[http://www.pizzadude.dk/fonts.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014518/http:/www.pizzadude.dk/fonts.php "http://www.pizzadude.dk/fonts.php")

I think the second C is easily adapted with a bit of rotation and scale, but I agree it probably is hand drawn.  
Tim
